description: Manage extensions on a VM scale set.

commands.name: az vmss extension delete
commands.summary: Delete an extension from a VMSS.
examples: az vmss extension delete --name MyExtension --resource-group MyResourceGroup --vmss-name MyVmss

commands.name: az vmss extension list
commands.summary: List extensions associated with a VMSS.
examples: az vmss extension list --resource-group MyResourceGroup --vmss-name MyVmss

commands.name: az vmss extension set
commands.summary: Add an extension to a VMSS or update an existing extension.
commands.syntax:
az vmss extension set --name
                      --publisher
                      --resource-group
                      --vmss-name
                      [--enable-auto-upgrade {false, true}]
                      [--extension-instance-name]
                      [--force-update]
                      [--no-auto-upgrade {false, true}]
                      [--no-auto-upgrade-minor-version {false, true}]
                      [--no-wait]
                      [--protected-settings]
                      [--provision-after-extensions]
                      [--settings]
                      [--version]
examples:
az vmss extension set --vmss-name my-vmss --name customScript --resource-group my-group \
    --version 2.0 --publisher Microsoft.Azure.Extensions \
    --provision-after-extensions NetworkWatcherAgentLinux VMAccessForLinux  \
    --settings '{"commandToExecute": "echo testing"}'
az vmss extension set -n extName --publisher publisher --vmss-name my-vmss -g my-group \ --enable-auto-upgrade true

commands.name: az vmss extension show
commands.summary: Show details on a VMSS extension.
examples: az vmss extension show --name MyExtension --resource-group MyResourceGroup --vmss-name MyVmss

commands.name: az vmss extension upgrade
commands.summary: Upgrade all extensions for all VMSS instances to the latest version.
examples: az vmss extension upgrade -g MyResourceGroup -n MyVmss
